title: Welcome & Introduction
content: Kronos ORM (Kotlin Reactive Object-Relational-Mapping) is a modern Kotlin ORM framework based on KCP and designed for K2.

title: Welcome & Introduction
content: Kronos is a lightweight framework that provides developers with a simple solution for interacting with multiple databases.

title: Welcome & Introduction
content: Kronos analyzes IR expression trees to simplify code logic, making ORM coding concise and semantic. Through a compiler plugin, we also provide a simple solution for converting between Pojo and Map.

title: Welcome & Introduction
content: The design philosophy behind Kronos is to address the shortcomings of existing ORM frameworks and provide a more convenient and efficient data operation experience based on coroutines and task mechanisms.

title: Code First
content: ORM（对象关系映射，Object-Relational Mapping）是一种将对象模型与关系数据库之间进行映射的技术。ORM允许开发者使用面向对象的编程方式来操作数据库，而无需直接编写SQL语句。

title: Code First
content: 在ORM中，"Code First"是一种开发方法，它强调从代码出发来定义数据库结构。具体来说，开发者首先通过编写类（通常是实体类）来定义数据模型，然后ORM框架根据这些类自动生成数据库表和关系。以下是Code First的一些关键特点：

title: Code First
content: 模型优先：开发者首先定义实体类及其属性，而不是先设计数据库表结构。这种方式使得开发者可以更专注于业务逻辑。

title: Code First
content: 自动迁移：许多ORM框架（如Entity Framework）支持自动迁移功能，可以根据代码中的变化自动更新数据库结构。这减少了手动修改数据库表的工作量。

title: Code First
content: 灵活性：Code First方法使得在开发过程中更容易进行模型的更改和调整，因为数据库结构是由代码驱动的。

title: Code First
content: 配置方式：开发者可以通过数据注解（Data Annotations）或Fluent API来配置实体类的映射关系，例如指定主键、外键、列名等。

title: Code First
content: 版本控制：由于数据库结构是由代码生成的，开发者可以将数据模型的变化纳入版本控制系统（如Git），这使得团队协作和代码审查变得更加容易。

title: Code First
content: 假设我们有一个简单的用户实体类：

title: Code First
content: 使用Code First，ORM框架会根据这个类自动生成一个名为user的数据库表，表中包含id、name和email这几个字段。

title: Code First
content: Code First是一种便捷且高效的方式来进行数据库开发，特别适合快速开发和迭代的场景。它使得开发者能够在代码层面上直接管理和维护数据模型，从而提高了开发效率和灵活性。

title: 加锁机制
content: Kronos共提供共享锁和独占锁两种悲观锁。

title: 加锁机制
content: Kronos提供共享锁，其锁等级为行锁。

title: 加锁机制
content: 共享锁也叫读锁或 S 锁，共享锁锁定的资源可以被其他用户读取，但不能修改。在进行SELECT 的时候，会将对象进行共享锁锁定，当数据读取完毕之后，就会释放共享锁，这样就可以保证数据在读取时不被修改。

title: 加锁机制
content: 在Kronos中，共享锁可用于📚查询记录 - lock设置查询时行锁与📚更新插入 - lock设置查询时行锁功能。

title: 加锁机制
content: Kronos提供独占锁，其锁等级为表锁。

title: 加锁机制
content: 独占锁也叫写锁或 X 锁，独占锁锁定的资源只能被当前用户修改，不能被其他用户读取。在进行SELECT 的时候，会将对象进行独占锁锁定，当数据读取完毕之后，就会释放独占锁，这样就可以保证数据在读取时不被修改。

title: 加锁机制
content: 在Kronos中，独占锁可用于📚查询记录 - lock设置查询时表锁与📚更新插入 - lock设置查询时表锁功能。

title: 加锁机制
content: Kronos提供乐观锁功能，可以在📚全局配置 - 乐观锁（版本）策略中设置全局乐观锁策略或通过📚注解配置 - @Version乐观锁（版本）列注解使用乐观锁功能。

title: 加锁机制
content: 被设置为乐观锁的列（默认为version，接下来均以该列为例）在记录新建时会被设置成0，后续每次更新version = version + 1

title: 加锁机制
content: 在执行更新插入(upsert)操作时，会将version字段添加进筛选项，意为仅当KPojo的该字段与数据库中修改次数一致时才会更新该条数据，否则则执行插入。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: NORMAL Mysql.KIndexType.NORMAL 普通索引，无需指定，MySQL默认使用该索引。UNIQUE Mysql.KIndexType.UNIQUE 唯一索引，用于保证数据唯一性。FULLTEXT Mysql.KIndexType.FULLTEXT 全文索引，只有MyISAM引擎支持，用于全文搜索。SPATIAL Mysql.KIndexType.SPATIAL 空间索引，用于空间数据类型，支持范围查询。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: UNIQUE PostgreSQL.KIndexType.UNIQUE 唯一索引，用于保证数据唯一性。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: NORMAL Oracle.KIndexType.NORMAL 普通索引，无需指定，Oracle默认使用该索引。BITMAP Oracle.KIndexType.BITMAP 位图索引，用于高并发查询，适用于低基数列。UNIQUE Oracle.KIndexType.UNIQUE 唯一索引，用于保证数据唯一性。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: CLUSTERED SqlServer.KIndexType.CLUSTERED 聚集索引，表中数据的物理顺序与索引的逻辑顺序一致。NONCLUSTERED SqlServer.KIndexType.NONCLUSTERED 非聚集索引，表中数据的物理顺序与索引的逻辑顺序不一致。XML SqlServer.KIndexType.XML XML索引，用于XML数据类型。SPATIAL SqlServer.KIndexType.SPATIAL 空间索引，用于空间数据类型。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: NOCASE SQLite.KIndexType.NOCASE 忽略大小写。RTRIM SQLite.KIndexType.RTRIM 忽略尾部空格。BINARY SQLite.KIndexType.BINARY 二进制比较。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: BTREE Mysql.KIndexMethod.BTREE 二叉树索引，最常见的索引类型，无需指定，MySQL默认使用该索引。HASH Mysql.KIndexMethod.HASH 哈希索引，只有Memory引擎支持，不支持范围查询。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: BTREE PostgreSQL.KIndexMethod.BTREE 二叉树索引，无需指定，PostgreSQL默认使用该索引。HASH PostgreSQL.KIndexMethod.HASH 哈希索引，用于等值查询，不支持范围查询。GIST PostgreSQL.KIndexMethod.GIST 通用索引，支持范围查询，支持空间索引。SPGIST PostgreSQL.KIndexMethod.SPGIST 空间索引，支持范围查询。GIN PostgreSQL.KIndexMethod.GIN 通用倒排索引，用于全文搜索。BRIN PostgreSQL.KIndexMethod.BRIN 区间索引，用于大表。

title: 索引类型和索引方法
content: UNIQUE SqlServer.KIndexMethod.UNIQUE 唯一索引，用于保证数据唯一性。

content: 本节将介绍如何在KPojo实体类中定义一对多级联关系。

title: 级联关系定义

title: 级联关系定义

title: 级联关系定义
content: 至此，Parent和Child两个实体类之间的一对多级联关系定义完成。

title: 级联关系定义
content: 通常我们认为，没有注解定义的一端为维护端，也是级联关系中的父端，而注解声明的一端为被维护端，也是级联关系中的子端。 在级联关系中，父端的变化会影响子端，而子端的变化不会影响父端。

title: 级联删除
content: @Cascade注解支持设置级联删除操作的策略，请参考：级联删除策略 。

title: 级联删除
content: 使用SET_DEFAULT策略时，需要在注解中指定defaultValue属性

title: 级联删除
content: defaultValue接受一个字符串数组，如["a", "b"]，对应关联实体的多个引用列的默认值

title: 级联删除
content: 若其中的某个引用列不需要修改，可以通过将其设置为RESERVED，Kronos在级联删除设置为SET_DEFAULT时会忽略该引用列，如：

title: 级联删除
content: 若顶层的删除函数使用了逻辑删除功能，若级联删除子层级的级联删除策略为CASCADE，那么删除子表数据时也会使用逻辑删除。

title: 级联删除
content: Kronos默认开启级联删除功能，需要在delete函数中显式关闭：

title: 级联删除
content: 当KPojo中有多个级联声明，但只有部分需要级联删除时，可以将需要级联删除的属性传入cascade函数，其余的属性及子属性将不触发级联删除。

title: 级联删除
content: 可以限制其子属性级联删除，如下：

title: 级联删除
content: 本节将介绍如何使用Kronos中定义的一对一级联关系的级联删除。

title: 级联删除
content: 我们定义User和Profile两个实体类，User实体类中包含了一个Profile实体类的引用，Profile实体类中包含了一个User 实体类的引用。

title: 级联删除
content: 删除User或Profile实体都会触发级联删除

title: 级联删除
content: 一对多关系和一对一关系的用法类似。

title: 级联删除
content: 首先，我们定义以下的Parent和Child两个实体类，Parent实体类中包含了一个Child实体类的集合，Child实体类中包含了一个 Parent实体类的引用。

title: 级联删除
content: 使用KPojo.delete()方法，可以实现一对多级联关系的级联删除。

title: 级联删除
content: 在Kronos中，仅支持Parent -> Child方向的级联删除，删除时先删除Child,再删除Parent，若多层级的任意一层级的关系存在Restrict级联删除策略，则不触发删除。

title: 级联删除
content: 以下是一个更加复杂的、层级更深的例子：

title: 级联删除
content: 通过manyToMany委托，Kronos简化多对多关系为一对多关系，并为您自动创建关联表记录，详见：📚级联关系定义 - 使用委托实现级联多对多跨中间表关系。

title: 级联删除
content: 首先我们定义User、Role、Relation三个实体类，其中Relation实体类中包含了User和Role两个实体类的引用，User和Role 通过manyToMany委托关联。

title: 级联删除
content: 插入User或Role实体都可以进行级联删除，根据注解定义的级联删除策略，级联删除会自动删除关联表记录。

title: Kotlin Type to KColumnType
content: The mapping relationship between common Kotlin types and Kronos column types is as follows: When the ColumnType annotation is not used, Kronos will automatically infer the database column type based on the Kotlin type. You can refer to the following table to view the mapping relationship between Kotlin data types and Kronos column types (KColumnType). The performance of Kronos column types varies in different databases. For details, please refer to Kronos column types.

title: Criteria for Filtering Records
content: 基于KCP，Kronos允许你使用真实的kotlin操作符来构建Criteria查询条件，如==、!=、>、<、>=、<=、in、|| 、&&等，而不是其他框架中eq、ne、gt、lt、ge、le等自定义操作符，而从表达式到Criteria对象的转换是在编译期完成的。

title: 数据库操作
content: 本章将介绍如何对数据库表进行创建、删除、清空、同步等操作。

title: Select Records
content: In Kronos, we can use the KPojo.select() method to query records in the database.

title: Select Records
content: The select method is used to specify the query field. At this time, Kronos will generate a query field statement based on the field set by the select method.

title: Select Records
content: You can pass in a string as the query field, use + to connect multiple fields, and the as method is used to set the field alias.

title: Select Records
section: Generate conditional statements and query records based on KPojo object values
content: When the by or where method is not used, Kronos will generate query conditional statements based on the values of the KPojo object.

title: Select Records
section: Generate conditional statements and query records based on KPojo object values
content: null values will not be included in the query conditions, that is, null values will not be used to generate query conditional statements. If you need to query null values, please use the where method to set the query conditions.

title: Select Records
content: The by method is used to set query conditions. At this time, Kronos will generate query condition statements based on the fields set by the by method.

title: Select Records
content: The where method is used to set query conditions. At this time, Kronos will generate query condition statements based on the fields set by the where method.

title: Select Records
section: to add parameters to custom query conditions
content: When the where condition contains custom SQL such as: where { "id = :id".asSql() }, you can use the patch method to add parameters to the custom query condition.

title: Select Records
content: The orderBy method is used to set sorting conditions. At this time, Kronos will generate sorting condition statements based on the fields set by the orderBy method.

title: Select Records
content: Use the asc method to set ascending sorting, and use the desc method to set descending sorting.

title: Select Records
content: When the sorting method is not set, the default is ascending sorting, such as: orderBy { it.id }.

title: Select Records
section: to set grouping and aggregation conditions
content: The groupBy method is used to set grouping conditions, and the having method is used to set aggregation conditions.

title: Select Records
section: to set the number of query records
content: The limit method is used to set the number of query records. At this time, Kronos will generate query condition statements based on the number of records set by the limit method.

title: Select Records
section: to set a row lock during query
content: The lock method is used to set a row lock during query. At this time, Kronos will add a lock according to the lock type set by the lock method.

title: Select Records
content: The page method is used to set up paging query. Please note that the parameters of the page method start from 1.

title: Select Records
content: The syntax of paging query is different in different databases. Kronos will generate corresponding paging query statements based on different databases.

title: Select Records
content: After using the page method, the query result will not include the total number of records by default. If you need to query the total number of records, please use the withTotal method.

title: Select Records
section: to set the query database (cross-database query)
content: The db method is used for cross-database query. In this case, Kronos will set the query database according to the parameters of the db method.

title: Select Records
section: method to query a single record
content: The single method is actually an abbreviation of limit(1) and is used to query a single record.

title: Select Records
section: method to query the Map list
content: The query method is used to execute a query and return a Map list.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryList to query a list of a specified type
content: The queryList method is used to execute a query and return a list of a specified type. It can accept generic parameters.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryList to query a list of a specified type
content: When querying a single column, you can directly set the generic parameter to the type of the column, for example: queryList().

title: Select Records
section: Use queryList to query a list of a specified type
content: When querying multiple columns, you can set the generic parameter to a subclass of KPojo, for example: queryList().

title: Select Records
section: Use queryList to query a list of a specified type
content: When no generic parameter is set, Kronos automatically converts the query result to the KPojo type of the query.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryList to query a list of a specified type
content: queryList uses KCP to convert Map to KPojo. For details, see: Conversion between KPojo and Map

title: Select Records
content: The queryMap method is used to execute a query and return a Map. When the query result is empty, null is returned.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOne to query a single record
content: The queryOne method is used to execute a query and return a single record. When the query result is empty, an exception is thrown. Generic parameters can be accepted.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOne to query a single record
content: When querying a single column, the generic parameter can be directly set to the column type, for example: queryOne()`.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOne to query a single record
content: When querying multiple columns, the generic parameter can be set to a subclass of KPojo, for example: queryOne()`.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOne to query a single record
content: When the generic parameter is not set, Kronos automatically converts the query result to the KPojo type of the query.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOne to query a single record
content: queryOne uses KCP to convert Map to KPojo. For details, see: KPojo and Map conversion

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOneOrNull to query a single record (optional)
content: Similar to the queryOne method, the queryOneOrNull method is used to execute a query and return a single record. When the query result is empty, it returns null and can accept generic parameters.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOneOrNull to query a single record (optional)
content: When querying a single column, you can directly set the generic parameter to the column type, for example: queryOneOrNull()`.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOneOrNull to query a single record (optional)
content: When querying multiple columns, you can set the generic parameter to a subclass of KPojo, for example: queryOneOrNull()`.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOneOrNull to query a single record (optional)
content: When the generic parameter is not set, Kronos automatically converts the query result to the KPojo type of the query.

title: Select Records
section: Use queryOneOrNull to query a single record (optional)
content: queryOneOrNull uses KCP to implement Map conversion to KPojo. For details, see: KPojo and Map conversion

title: Select Records
section: to query a paginated query with a total number of records
content: The withTotal method is used to query a paginated query with a total number of records. In this case, Kronos will include the total number of records in the query results.

title: Select Records
section: to query a paginated query with a total number of records
content: The withTotal method returns a PageClause object, and you can use the query, queryList and other methods to get the query results.

title: Select Records
content: In Kronos, we can use a specified data source to query records in the database.

title: 连表查询
content: 本章将介绍如何查询多表关联数据（或许您也想看看📚级联查询）。

title: 连表查询
content: 在Kronos中，我们可以使用KPojo.join(KPojo1, KPojo2, ...)方法来查询多表关联数据。

title: 连表查询
section: 指定连接条件及连接方式
fragment: 指定连接条件及连接方式
content: 在Kronos中，我们默认使用left join连接多表，如果不需要指定连接方式，可以使用on方法指定连接条件。

title: 连表查询

fragment: 指定连接条件及连接方式

fragment: 指定连接数据表的数据库跨库连表查询
content: 将一张或多张表与其所处的数据库名组合通过一个或多个Pair类作为参数传入该方法进行跨库连表查询

title: 连表查询
content: 可以使用as为字段指定别名，如select { user.id + user.name.`as`("userName") + userInfo.age }。

title: 连表查询
content: 如需要查询某张表的所有字段，可以使用select { user }、select { user + userInfo + userTeam.teamId }。

content: 不指定查询字段时，默认查询所有字段，我们会对不同表相同字段进行重新命名，以避免字段冲突。

title: 连表查询
content: 可以使用字符串作为自定义查询字段，如select { "count(`user.id`)".as("count") }。

title: 全局设置
content: 在数据库操作时，若不指定数据源，kronos会自动使用该默认数据源。

title: 全局设置
content: 数据源类型为KronosDataSourceWrapper，创建方法可参考：📚连接到数据库。

title: 全局设置

title: 全局设置
content: Kronos支持多数据源与动态数据源

title: 全局设置
content: 多数据源：在具体操作时，如KPojo.update.execute(wrapper)，可以在execute函数中传入其他KronosDataSourceWrapper 实例，从而使用其他的数据源。

title: 全局设置
content: 动态数据源：Kronos.dataSource是一个函数，您可以在该函数中实现您的逻辑返回不同的数据源实例，实现动态数据源。

title: 全局设置
content: 表名策略指在默认情况下（无注解配置），kronos自动根据Kotlin类名生成数据库的表名，如：User -> user。

title: 全局设置
content: 创建来自定义表名策略KronosNamingStrategy详见：概念 - 命名策略 。

title: 全局设置
content: 我们默认提供了LineHumpNamingStrategy和NoneNamingStrategy两种表名策略：

title: 全局设置
content: 该策略将kotlin类名转换为下划线分隔的小写字符串，如：ADataClass -> a_data_class ，将数据库表/列名转为驼峰命名，如：user_name -> userName。

title: 全局设置
content: 该策略将kotlin类名保持原样，如：ADataClass -> ADataClass，将数据库表/列名保持原样，如：user_name -> user_name。

title: 全局设置
content: 默认情况下，kronos使用的就是NoneNamingStrategy表名策略。

title: 全局设置
content: 同全局表名策略类似，列名策略指在默认情况下，kronos自动根据Kotlin类的属性名生成列名，如：classId -> class_id。

content: 用于设置全局默认条件下，当where/having/on等条件语句中的值为null时，生成SQL语句的策略。

title: 全局设置
content: 如在查询场景下，条件值为null时可能想要忽略该查询条件，或将其转为is null，is not null等条件。 NoValueStrategy策略用于处理在不同场景下的null值条件

title: 全局设置
content: 注意，如果您正在自定义无值策略，在DELETE和UPDATE操作中，请谨慎使用Ignore策略，以免造成全表删除或全表更新。

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Declaring a data class as a table class in Kronos is very simple. You just need to make the class inherit from KPojo. Here is a simple example:

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: For more complex data classes and when working with database table operations, here are examples of table creation statements in different databases:

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: We define the properties of the data table through annotations and configuration options, such as primary keys, auto-increment, unique keys, and indexes.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Why use annotations instead of Kotlin DSL?

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: We read annotation information through a compiler plugin and store the information in the entity class definition, so that all table structure parsing occurs at compile time rather than runtime. While this approach sacrifices some flexibility, it helps avoid runtime performance overhead.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: You can create a custom table naming strategy by implementing a class that extends KronosNamingStrategy (see: Naming Strategy), and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: We provide a default LineHumpNamingStrategy for table naming:

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: This strategy converts Kotlin class names to lowercase strings separated by underscores, e.g., ADataClass -> a_data_class, and converts database table/column names to camel case, e.g., user_name -> userName.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Similar to the table naming strategy, you can create a custom field naming strategy by implementing a class that extends KronosNamingStrategy, and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: We also provide the LineHumpNamingStrategy as the default field naming strategy.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: You can customize the create time strategy by creating a class that implements KronosCommonStrategy (see: Common Strategy), and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: The create time strategy is globally disabled by default and needs to be manually enabled.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Even after setting the global create time strategy, you can still override it in a KPojo class using the @CreateTime annotation.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Similar to the create time strategy, you can customize the update time strategy by creating a class that implements KronosCommonStrategy, and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: The update time strategy is globally disabled by default and needs to be manually enabled.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Even after setting the global update time strategy, you can still override it in a KPojo class using the @UpdateTime annotation.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: You can customize the logic delete strategy by creating a class that implements KronosCommonStrategy, and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: The logic delete strategy is globally disabled by default and needs to be manually enabled.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Even after setting the global logic delete strategy, you can still override it in a KPojo class using the @LogicDelete annotation.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: You can customize the optimistic lock strategy by creating a class that implements KronosCommonStrategy, and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: You can also configure each entity object individually using Column Optimistic Lock.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: The optimistic lock strategy is globally disabled by default and needs to be manually enabled.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Even after setting the global optimistic lock strategy, you can still override it in a KPojo class using the @Version annotation.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Kronos uses the current system timezone by default. You can modify the default timezone as follows:

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: You can create a custom serialization resolver by implementing a class that extends KronosSerializeResolver, and then specify this implementation in the configuration file.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: For example, you can use the GSON library to implement a serialization resolver:

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: In this example, we use the GSON library to implement a serialization resolver. You can use any library such as Kotlinx.serialization, Jackson, Moshi, FastJson, etc.

content: This annotation is used to declare column associations, including association queries, association inserts, association updates, association deletions, etc. It supports one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one, and many-to-many associations.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: Kronos treats associated columns as custom properties and does not recognize them as database fields.

title: Table Class Definition and Configuration
content: The association feature in Kronos does not require defining foreign keys. Only defining the association relationship in the entity class is needed to achieve association queries, association inserts, association updates, association deletions, etc.
